TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
30 Vita sancti vincentij Martyris.
SEint Vincent In spayne &punctelev; to a cristine bischop cam
Þat men cleopeden valentin &punctelev; and cristindom of him nam
Þe king[al. iustice] of þe londeâ€” &punctelev; Dacian was is name
For þe bischop cristine was &punctelev; he þou&yogh;te to don him schame
he let him nime and binde &punctelev; and don him in grete pine
Þe bischop cride &yogh;erne on god &punctelev; he nolde oþur fine
With heom þat him tormenteden &punctelev; he spac with milde speche
Seint Vincent was þarefore wrath &punctelev; and seide: "ich mot þe teche
&YOGH;wy spext þov so mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei þov adrad were
Wenstþou þat heo þine Maistres beon? &punctelev; &yogh;warof hauest þov fere
Spec hardiliche, and conforte wel &punctelev; oþure þat cristine beoth
Þat heo mowe to þe deþe hardie beon &punctelev; ase heo þe iseoth!"
"hov is þis?" seide þe king &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þes þef wene fi&yogh;te
And withsegge us al abrod? &punctelev; Ich him schal euene di&yogh;te
Lateth þene bischop awei gon &punctelev; for is milde speche
Nimez vincent and bindez anon &punctelev; we schullen him oþur tech[e]
With scourges and with staues &punctelev; faste &yogh;e him bete
Þat he ne mouw iwielde neuere a lime &punctelev; are þat &yogh;e him lete!"
"&YOGH;e," seide vincent, "þov pai&yogh;est me wel &punctelev; þi word ne þinchez me nou&yogh;t ille
Ine fond neuere Man þat so wel &punctelev; acordede to mi wille
¶ Nov ich hopie to habbe game &punctelev; for erore me þou&yogh;te longe
hit schal me tuyrne to Ioye and gleo &punctelev; and þe to[MS. to þe] pines stronge."
Þe tormentores nomen þane holie Man &punctelev; and to a piler him bounde
With staues and scourges heo leiden on him[al. him on] &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Þo heo &yogh;euen him sorest duntes &punctelev; lei&yogh;en he gan wel smere
Þe tormentores seten adoun and cleopeden help &punctelev; þo heo werie were
And seiden &punctelev; "we beoth nouþe ouercome &punctelev; ore Armes aketh sore
he[l]pez us and betez þesne[MS. þesne þesne] þeof &punctelev; for we ne mowen non[MS. nou] more."
Þo was þe king wroth with heom &punctelev; he let heom anou take
Some he let tormenti sore &punctelev; þat ech bon heom gan Ake
And some he let to deþe bringue &punctelev; and some in oþur turment
Euere he let ferschi and nevny[r. nevuy?] &punctelev; tormentores to seint Vincent
&YOGH;wane heo weren werie of bete &punctelev; þe holi man bigan to speke
"Louerd, iwuyrþed beo þi name &punctelev; nouþe ich am swiþe wel awreke
Þe more þat heo betez me &punctelev; þe betere me is, iwis
to heom i[t] torneþ to pine and sor &punctelev; and me to Ioie and blis."
¶ "Ne mowe we nov&yogh;t," seide þe king &punctelev; "with noþing þarto it bringe
Þat þov nelt nemme þine false god &punctelev; for no luþur betinge?"
"Þov luþere Man," seide Vincent &punctelev; "&yogh;eot þou most tormenti more
Ine habbe nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot tormenz inouwe &punctelev; þarafter me longez sore."
Þo he was iscourget so &punctelev; þat men mi&yogh;ten iseo ech bon
And euerech Ioynt and senue &punctelev; þe king gan ner him gon
"Vincent," he seide, "haue of þiself &punctelev; revþe and merci
Ne lat þov nonmore þi fa[i]re bodi &punctelev; þus defouli
bilief on ovre godes and torne anon &punctelev; þi þou&yogh;t and þi mod
And ischal þe &yogh;iue ope al mi lond &punctelev; pouwer gret and guod."
"beo stille," seide seint vincent &punctelev; "al Atter is þi lore
beo stille anon, þou deueles tonge &punctelev; þou makest me drede sore
hit me greueth þat þov feinest þe &punctelev; more þane al þe pine
And alle þe tormens þat þov me dest &punctelev; þov and alle þine
Þat þov bileuest þine tormenz so sone &punctelev; and art bineoþe ibrou&yogh;t
&YOGH;eot þou most more Ioye &punctelev; bringen in mi þou&yogh;t."
"Þov schalt &yogh;eot," seide þe king &punctelev; mo tormenz afonge."
he let him lede withoute þe toun &punctelev; and on a gibet him honge
Vincent for Ioie bigan to eorne &punctelev; þo he iheorde þis dom
Þare nas non þat him mi&yogh;te ouertake &punctelev; are he to þe gibat com
Þo þat he anhengut was &punctelev; gret Ioye he made and blisse
Euere he prechede ase he heng &punctelev; godes wordes to wisse
Þe lengore þat he þare heng &punctelev; þe more Ioie he made
Þo gradden þe tormentores &punctelev; "we ne schullen neuere ouercome þis tade."
¶ Atþe laste he nomen him adoun &punctelev; and ladden bifore þe kinge
And seiden þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten him &punctelev; for noþing to deþe bringe
"Alas," seide þe king þo &punctelev; "is ore mi&yogh;te us binome
&YOGH;wareof seruieth ovre godes &punctelev; þat þes þeof us schal ouercome
Ledez him withoute þe toun &punctelev; a gret fuyr &yogh;e þare make
And þat he beo amidde ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; and ibounde to one stake
Forbrenne he schal euerech lime &punctelev; ne schal he þus him wer[e]
And &yogh;wane he is to douste Ibarnd &punctelev; we beoth ibrou&yogh;t of care."
Þe tormentores nomen seint Vincent &punctelev; and duden þe kingus heste
Þe holi man wende into þe fuyr &punctelev; ase gladliche ase to one feste
Þo heo wenden þat seint vincent &punctelev; to douste ibrend were
heo ornen hom and tolden þe kinge fore &punctelev; gladdore neuere heo nere
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone hom come &punctelev; þat seint vincent nas er
At home and stod bifore þe kingeâ€” &punctelev; mani sori man was þer
¶ Þe tormentores tolden þe kingue &punctelev; hov he ibarnd was
"Alas! alas!" þe king seide &punctelev; "neuerer ischend inas
Schal þeos þef us ouercome? &punctelev; Mahun, nou þin ore
Þei he grete tormenz habbe ihaued &punctelev; &yogh;eot ich can biþenche more."
he let nime platus of Ire &punctelev; sumdel þunne and brode
And let heom legge amidde þe place &punctelev; wel nei&yogh; ane cartes lode
gret fuyr he let þaron make &punctelev; and þo heo glowinde were
Þat wodefuyr heo duden al awei &punctelev; þane guode man þudere heo bere
And on þe berninde plates him casten &punctelev; and some þarof heo toke
And leiden anouewarde is holi bodi &punctelev; mid one Irene croke
Al he was þaron ihudâ€” &punctelev; þe &yogh;ut nadde he none fere
Þat grece of him orn abrod &punctelev; ase þei it frijnge were
Þe swyþere þat he barnde &punctelev; þe gladdore he him made
he lou&yogh; smere, &yogh;wane þe plates &punctelev; In is flesch gonne wade
Atþe biginningue he was glad &punctelev; and gladdore atþenende
"Alas! alas," þe king seide þo &punctelev; "þes þef us wole schende
Þis torment ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; anoþur we moten biþenche."
he let maken a swyþe gret fuyr &punctelev; þat noþing ne mi&yogh;te aquenche
¶ Seint Vincent huy lei[den] amidewarde &punctelev; and sethþe salt heo nome
And Mid ladeles on is wondene it casten &punctelev; in[al. & in] þe fuyr ilome
So þat þe salt scholde is woundene frete &punctelev; with þe brenninde fuyre
Þe spranglinge of þe blode iselt &punctelev; wide men mi&yogh;ten ihuyre
"&YOGH;e," seide þis guode man &punctelev; "þis is a swete feste
Mani Ioye ichabbe ihaued &punctelev; ake þis is on þe meste."
&YOGH;wane is blod spreinde In þe rof an hei&yogh; &punctelev; he gan to lei&yogh;en smere
Þanne was þe king and alle is men &punctelev; In swyþe grete fere
And seiden &punctelev; "þes þef us wole ouercome. &punctelev; Mahun, &yogh;ware is þi mi&yogh;te
Schal þes þef with is wichchinge &punctelev; a&yogh;en þi power fi&yogh;te?"
"&YOGH;eot Ich þenche," seide þe king &punctelev; "of one pine stronge
beo þes þef þaron ido &punctelev; he ne schal nou&yogh;t libbe longe."
heo setten him in a swyþe deork put &punctelev; þat in þe gayhole was
So ful of sweordes pointes ipi&yogh;te &punctelev; ase Mede is ful of gras
Þareoppe þanne holi man &punctelev; heo casten, faste ibounde
Þat þe pointes of þe swerdes scholden &punctelev; &yogh;iuen him deþes woundes
Faste heo loken alle þe dore &punctelev; and leten him longe þere beo
Ope þe swerdes pointes in deorkhede &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te noþing iseo
Þare cam an Aungel with a taper &punctelev; brenninde in is hond
Of his pine he bar him opâ€” &punctelev; and þare was godes sonde
¶ Þe Aungel was þar with him &punctelev; ase longe ase he þare was
Mid a brenninde taper, and Ioie gret &punctelev; þat neuere more nas
Þo it was longe þareafturward &punctelev; þis men comen þerbiside
And wende þat he were ded &punctelev; ane stounde heo gonne abide
Þo iheorden heo þis holi man &punctelev; loude and murie singe
And herede god in heuene. &punctelev; heo tolden þat þe kinge
Þo was þe þing nei&yogh; iswowe &punctelev; and seide, sichinde wel sore
"Alas, we beoth nouþe ouercome &punctelev; Ine can[MS. cam] þenche non more
Ovre godes ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat alle þing habbeth to wolde
Inelle neuereeft a&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;te &punctelev; creaunt ichulle me holde
¶ &YOGH;wane no pine ne mai him sle &punctelev; oþur þing ichulle fonde
"goth," he seide, "and maketh a bed &punctelev; þat softeste in anie londe
Of quoiltene and of materasz &punctelev; of cheisel and of palle
And þanne leggez him þaron &punctelev; swiþe softe withalle."
Þo þat bed was imaket &punctelev; to þe gayhole heo wende
And founden þare þat lij&yogh;t of heuene &punctelev; þat ore louerd þudere sende
Wel softe heo nomen þis holi man &punctelev; and custen is sore wounden
to Relikes heo gadereden stilleliche &punctelev; þat heo of is blode founden
heo leiden him in þat nesche bed. &punctelev; and þo he was þaron
his preiere he dude to ore louerd crist &punctelev; and deide þo anon
Þo þe king isai&yogh; þis þat he deide &punctelev; so mildeliche in is bedde
"tormenz," he seide, "we him habbeth ido &punctelev; vuele þarof us spedde
Ded we wolleth him ouercome &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mi&yogh;ten aliue
Into þe wilde felde &punctelev; þat bodi &yogh;e beren wel bliue
Wilde bestes and foules &punctelev; todrawe heo schullen it sone."
Þis men brou&yogh;ten þat bodi þare &punctelev; and duden þe kingus bone
Þare cam fleo a Rauon &punctelev; and adoun þarebi he ali&yogh;te
Kene and suyþe dredful &punctelev; iredi he was to fi&yogh;te
&yogh;if þare come ani foul to &punctelev; þat þis bodi isei&yogh;e
Þe Rauon smot to grounde &punctelev; ne mosten þare come non nei&yogh;e
¶ Ake Euere he drof heom awei &punctelev; þudere &yogh;wane heo come
Ne mi&yogh;te þare come none so kene &punctelev; þat o mossel þarof nome
A wolf cam also þuderward &punctelev; is mete forto fette
And wolde of þat bodi nime. &punctelev; þe Rauon a&yogh;ein him sette
he flev and smot with bile and fot &punctelev; þat þe wolf atþen ende
blodi was and ouercome &punctelev; a&yogh;en hamward he gan wende
Þe Rauon wuste þis bodi longe &punctelev; Iwemmed nou&yogh;t it nas
Þo þe king it onder&yogh;at &punctelev; þat þe bodi ihol was
hom he let it fette a&yogh;en &punctelev; and seide, "&yogh;wat may beo ovre red
þat we ne mouwen him ouercome &punctelev; noþer quik ne ded
&YOGH;if we ne mouwen quik ne ded &punctelev; ouercome him alonde
For no[MS. ne] quoyntise þat we mouwen do &punctelev; awatere we wollez fonde."
he let it lede fer into þe se &punctelev; and bonde þarto mani a ston
And casten it out of a schip. &punctelev; it bigan to sinke anon
þo þe Mariners iseien þis &punctelev; glade heo weren and bliþe
Forto telle þe kinge fore &punctelev; heo hi&yogh;eden hom wel bliue
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone to londe come &punctelev; þat heo ne founden alonde
Þis holi Man wel faire ligge &punctelev; abouen þe sesonde
Sore agremed and aschamed &punctelev; hom huy gonne wende
Þe kinge heo tolden al heore cas &punctelev; fram þe furste to þe ende
"Alas, alas," þe king seide &punctelev; "þe schame and þe schonde
We ne mowe him neuere ouercome &punctelev; quik ne ded, awatere ne alonde
¶ Do we him out of ovre þou&yogh;t &punctelev; we ne mouwen us neuere awreke
Ich drede þat he mi bane worþe &punctelev; Ihere ich more of him speke."
Ani&yogh;t In slepe seint Vincent cam &punctelev; to A womman þarebiside
And tolde hire &yogh;ware is bodi lai &punctelev; and bad hire nou&yogh;t to longe abide
Ake þat heo it scholde burie sone &punctelev; for him longuede after reste
Þis guode womman it onderstod &punctelev; þo heo awok, with þe beste
heo wende and sou&yogh;te þis holi bodi &punctelev; and fond it swiþe sone
heo dude it burie with gret honour &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t was forto done
Þus seint vincent þe holie man &punctelev; in Spayne endede is lif
And wende to þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; after þis pines and strif
Men nusten neuere martyr non &punctelev; þat hadde more torment
Ne þat with som pine ouercome nas &punctelev; bote þe gode man seint vincent
